channel.title: Looking for web designer to shower with money and praise
channel.description:
Hey, I have a project right now that requires a solid graphics + HTML/CSS guy.
Before I continue: [b]Payment for this project is to be paid as a percentage of profits, for the lifetime of the site.[/b] If you are not comfortable with that, then sorry this is not for you. As for how much that will be, who knows, however I can say that there is a niche target market ready and waiting, and a business model that is more than just "throw up some google ads" so the potential is relatively high. You will not become a millionaire, but you stand to earn more than pocket money. After the initial design, you will not be expected to remain "on the books" in the sense that there will be a high workload, but I may require the odd tweak or addition occasionally and since you'll still be getting paid you should be cool with that.
[u]Requirements[/u]:
[ul][li]Proven, strong graphics skills. Ability to take a design from blank slate through concept to polish, given requirements and a short description of vision. You'll be working only with me, and I'm not much of an arty guy. My creative input will be minimal, this is on you.[/li] [li]Ability to chop and code ([X]HTML/CSS) the layout. I will probably be rewriting the XHTML anyway to fit the app to some degree, so you don't need to be a ninja, but you need to be able to at least get the design out of Photoshop or whatever and into something a browser will interpret. I can help with this if needs be, but you gotta have something in the way of skillz.[/li] [li]Javascript skills are a massive plus. Not required, but I'd love it if you could do any JQuery stuff etc. yourself.[/li] [li][i]Must be able to work fast.[/i] I'm looking to get 'er done pretty quick, and I write Ruby pretty quick when I'm on a mission. I'm not saying you have to be jobless like me and have all the time in the world, or dedicate a certain number of hours when I say so, but if you're about to leave on vacation or start a new college or whatever, this isn't for you sorry.[/li][/ul]
Email me at pizzey.sam+wikm@gmail.com if you'd like more information, or think you're up to the task. Include desired cut and examples of work.
Peace :)

item.title: Looking for web designer to shower with money and praise
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:12, topic:378342”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=474217.msg3490743#msg3490743 date=1296930904]
I would be interested, but I don’t do any graphics for web, only coding.
[/quote]This is why I didn’t suggest myself. It’s weird though because you’re a “Graphics Master”, I would assume you would be fit for the job given that you do actually have web design experience :o[/quote]

I do a lot of website building at work, and not just static websites. I’m awful at making designs for them, other people usually do that.

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for web designer to shower with money and praise

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I Vain I, in your PSC, you are asking for people to do graphics for you, and yet in here you are applying to do graphics?

item.title: Looking for web designer to shower with money and praise
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Of course I have no problem with people using that technique.

When I said “chop” I merely referred to getting the design out of photoshop and into a working page, it could also be read as “i’d really rather not do your html+css for you, i want to concentrate on writing ruby”

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for web designer to shower with money and praise

item.title: Looking for web designer to shower with money and praise

item.description:

^ That’s what google does, but who cares. It’s easy to slice images and put them to xhtml/css.

ITS NOT SELLING IT IS PROVIDING A BUSINESS OPPORTUNITY

nonetheless, if it’s a problem i shall remove it

you all know i wouldn’t scam anyone from here though
